qas.question: Why did pritz klein come up with the KSOG?

answers.text: response to the criticism of the Kinsey scale only measuring two dimensions of sexual orientation

qas.question: What kind of scale does the KSOG use?
What three points in life does the KSOG evaluate?

answers.text: past (from early adolescence up to one year ago), present (within the last 12 months), and ideal (what would you choose if it were completely your choice).

context: In <a2_0>response to the criticism of the Kinsey scale only measuring two dimensions of sexual orientation<a2_0/>, <a1_0>Fritz Klein<a1_0/> developed the <a0_0>Klein sexual orientation grid<a0_0/> (KSOG), a multidimensional scale for describing sexual orientation. Introduced in Klein's book The Bisexual Option, the KSOG uses <a3_0>a 7-point scale<a3_0/> to assess seven different dimensions of sexuality at three different points in an individual's life: <a4_0>past (from early adolescence up to one year ago), present (within the last 12 months), and ideal (what would you choose if it were completely your choice).
